Package org.svvrl.goal.core.layout

Class ForceTransferAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.layout.AbstractLayout
org.svvrl.goal.core.layout.ForceTransferAlgorithm
All Implemented Interfaces:
Layout
public class ForceTransferAlgorithm
extends AbstractLayout
This class provides an implementation of the force-transfer algorithm in [Xiaodi Huang, Wei Lai, A. S. M. Sajeev, Junbin Gao: A new algorithm for removing node overlapping in graph visualization. Information Sciences, 177(14): 2821-2844 (2007)]. This implementation may be incorrect because the algorithm described in the paper is incomplete and may contain typos. It seems that the pseudo code in the paper is not consistent with its textual description. Note that the update of variable i in the pseudo code for left horizontal scan in the paper [Xiaodi Huang and Wei Lai. Force-transfer: a new approach to removing overlapping nodes in graph layout. ACSC 2003. 349-358] is definitely wrong. It is weird that the nodes are sorted only once by x coordinates (and then by y coordinates if two nodes have the same x coordinate). In this case, the vertical scan will not visit nodes one by one along the y-axis from the seed node.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai
